com.genband.kandy.api.provisioning

Interface IKandyProvisioning


  • public interface IKandyProvisioning

    Subscriber Provisioning

    This interface is used to handle subscriber provisioning.

    You can add subscribers in two ways:

    • Admin – can create (multiple) subscribers directly using the web GUI.

      click the link: https://portal.kandy.io/my-kandy
      and click on: Manage

    • Users – can create individual subscribers using the Reference Application:
      1. The user opens the application and is prompted for a username, password, and phone number
      2. The Kandy server sends an SMS to the supplied phone number, with a validation code
      3. The user enters this code to complete the registration process

      Deprecated. 
      Please use requestCode(KandyValidationMethoud, String, String, String, KandyResponseListener)

      Subscriber Provisioning

      You can add subscribers in two ways:

      • Admin – can create (multiple) subscribers directly using the web GUI.

        click the link: https://portal.kandy.io/my-kandy
        and click on: Manage

      • Users – can create individual subscribers using the Reference Application:
        1. The user opens the application and is prompted for a username, password, and phone number
        2. The Kandy server sends an SMS to the supplied phone number, with a validation code

    • Method Detail

      • requestCode

        void requestCode(KandyValidationMethoud validationMethoud,
                 String destination,
                 String twoLetterISOCountryCode,
                 KandyResponseListener listener)
        Deprecated. Please use requestCode(KandyValidationMethoud, String, String, String, KandyResponseListener)

        Subscriber Provisioning

        You can add subscribers in two ways:

        • Admin – can create (multiple) subscribers directly using the web GUI.

          click the link: https://portal.kandy.io/my-kandy
          and click on: Manage

        • Users – can create individual subscribers using the Reference Application:
          1. The user opens the application and is prompted for a username, password, and phone number
          2. The Kandy server sends an SMS to the supplied phone number, with a validation code
          3. The user enters this code to complete the registration process
        Parameters:
        validationMethoud - - the method user will get the OTP - by SMS or Call
        destination - Could be or phone number or email or voice call to subscriber with
        twoLetterISOCountryCode - The registered phone number twoLetterISOCountryCode Optionally in case and destination isn't phone number
        listener - The callback that will be invoked
        See Also:
        ISO_3166, KandyLocationService#getCountryInfo(com.genband.kandy.api.services.location.KandyCountryInfoResponseListener)}

      • requestCode

        void requestCode(KandyValidationMethoud validationMethoud,
                 String destination,
                 String twoLetterISOCountryCode,
                 String callerPhonePrefix,
                 KandyResponseListener listener)

        Subscriber Provisioning

        You can add subscribers in two ways:

        • Admin – can create (multiple) subscribers directly using the web GUI.

          click the link: https://portal.kandy.io/my-kandy
          and click on: Manage

        • Users – can create individual subscribers using the Reference Application:
          1. The user opens the application and is prompted for a username, password, and phone number
          2. The Kandy server sends an SMS to the supplied phone number, with a validation code
          3. The user enters this code to complete the registration process

        Notes:

        • The parameter twoLetterISOCountryCode are two-letter country codes defined in ISO_3166. it can be received using the KandyLocationService#getCountryInfo(com.genband.kandy.api.services.location.KandyCountryInfoResponseListener) api
        • The verification method currently supports only SMS
        Example: 
         
 KandyValidationMethoud validationMethoud = KandyValidationMethoud.SMS OR KandyValidationMethoud.CALL
 String username = "username@domain";
 String twoLetterISOCountryCode = "IL"
 
 Kandy.getProvisioning().requestCode(validationMethoud, username, twoLetterISOCountryCode, callerPhonePrefix, new KandyResponseListener() {
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestFailed(int responseCode, String err) {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestSucceded() {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 });
        Parameters:
        validationMethoud - - the method user will get the OTP - by SMS or Call
        destination - Could be or phone number or email or voice call to subscriber with
        twoLetterISOCountryCode - The registered phone number twoLetterISOCountryCode Optionally in case and destination isn't phone number
        callerPhonePrefix - The prefix that is used as a part of incoming call CLI containing the validation code. The prefix could be NULL, in this case - prefix won't be passed to the server
        listener - The callback that will be invoked
        See Also:
        ISO_3166, KandyLocationService#getCountryInfo(com.genband.kandy.api.services.location.KandyCountryInfoResponseListener)}

      • validateAndProvision

        void validateAndProvision(String phoneNumber,
                          String validationCode,
                          String twoLetterISOCountryCode,
                          KandyValidationResponseListener listener)
        This call sends the received code to the server for validation.

        Example: 

         
 String phonenumber = "phonenumber";
 String validationCode = "1234";
 String twoLetterISOCountryCode = "IL";
 Kandy.getProvisioning().validateAndProvision(phonenumber, validationCoide, twoLetterISOCountryCode, new KandyValidationResponseListener() {
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestFailed(int responseCode, String err) {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestSuccess(IKandyValidationResponse response) {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 });
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber -
        validationCode -
        twoLetterISOCountryCode -
        listener - The callback that will be invoked

      • deactivate

        void deactivate(KandyResponseListener listener)
        This method deactivates a currently active subscriber.

        Example: 

         
 Kandy.getProvisioning().deactivate(new KandyResponseListener() {
 
     @Override
     public void onRequestFailed(int responseCode, String err) {
    //TODO insert your code here
     }
 
     @Override
    public void onRequestSucceded() {
    //TODO insert your code here
     }
 });
        Parameters:
        listener - The callback that will be invoked The callback that will be invoked

                    KandyProvsionResponseListener listener)

        userId - The user id

      • getUserProvisionInfo

        void getUserProvisionInfo(String twoLetterISOCountryCode,
                          String destination,
                          KandyProvisionInfoResponseListener listener)
        Get User's provision information
        Parameters:
        twoLetterISOCountryCode - The registered phone number twoLetterISOCountryCode Optionally in case and destination isn't phone number
        destination - Could be or phone number or email or voice call to subscriber with
        listener - The callback that will be invoked. Will return the result of the request in case of fail will return error and error code in case of success will return object KandyUserProvisionInfo which contains the user provision information
